arts.ttl: Rangers namechecked in Hjalmar Ekdal transfer tug of war hours after Ibrox warning over short term fixes
arts.sum: The 26-year-old has been beset by injuries during his time at Turf Moor and the Sweden defender is now available for loan

arts.ttl: Burnley fend off Reading after extra time
arts.sum: Watch highlights as Championship high-flyers Burnley fend off a gutsy fightback from League One Reading in the third round of the FA Cup.

arts.ttl: Reading boss 'proud' despite FA Cup exit but confirms long-term injury to defender
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt has confirmed that defender Amadou Mbengue is to miss 'six to eight weeks' with a knee injury. The popular defender missed New Year's Day's win over Cambridge with illness but returned to feature in the 0-0 draw with Charlton Athletic last week. Not involved in today's 3-1 defeat to Burnley in the FA Cup, Hunt has confirmed he is to miss a period of time with a knee injury. "Amadou suffered a knee injury in the Charlton game which we didn’t know about until Monday- he didn’t feel anything until late on Sunday. He was one of the ill ones this week and when we scanned it, it showed up. He’s going to miss six to eight weeks."

arts.ttl: Scott Parker's immediate reaction to Burnley's extra-time FA Cup win against Reading
arts.sum: Scott Parker felt his heavily-rotated Burnley side thoroughly deserved their FA Cup third round win against Reading, despite being made to work hard for their progression.

arts.ttl: Burnley FA Cup player ratings vs Reading as SIX 8/10s and one 5/10 dished out after extra-time win - gallery
arts.sum: Burnley edged into the fourth round of the FA Cup with an after-extra-time 3-1 win against League One side Reading.

arts.ttl: Zian Flemming’s extra-time brace helps Burnley see off Reading in FA Cup
arts.sum: Lyle Foster put a much-changed Clarets side ahead only for Lewis Wing to equalise soon after.

arts.ttl: Reading take heavily-rotated Burnley to extra time but exit FA Cup at Round Three
arts.sum: Reading took Championship promotion-chasing Burnley to extra-time, but exited the FA Cup in Round Three following a 3-1 defeat at the Select Car Leasing Stadium. The Clarets took the lead in the second half through Lyle Foster but Lewis Wing's long-range strike squirmed through goalkeeper Vlad Hladky's body moments later to take the game into an extra 30 minutes. First-team regular Zian Flemming scored the winner in the first period of extra-time to see them into Round Four. Noel Hunt hinted that he would field a strong side in the build-up to the tie, and he did just that. Only three changes were made from the team that drew 1-1 at Charlton Athletic last week while Scott Parker made 11 changes for Burnley, who sit second in the Championship.

arts.ttl: Reading 1-3 Burnley: Zian Flemming strikes twice as Clarets need extra-time to edge past League One opposition
arts.sum: Zian Flemming came off the bench to score twice as Burnley needed extra-time to beat League One Reading in the FA Cup.

arts.ttl: 'A horrible moment!' Long-range shot goes through Burnley keeper's legs
arts.sum: Burnley goalkeeper Vaclav Hladky sees a long-range shot from Reading's Lewis Wing goes through his legs and into the net during their third-round FA Cup tie.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Noel Hunt names strong side for Burnley FA Cup clash
arts.sum: Noel Hunt has named a strong side for this afternoon's FA Cup Third Round clash with Burnley, including the likes of Harvey Knibbs and Lewis Wing. The Royals beat Fleetwood Town and Harborough Town to reach this stage, with Scott Parker's Clarets sat second in the Championship. With clear week's either side, Hunt hinted that he would start strong, and he has done just that. Cup keeper David Button starts between the posts, with a back four of Tivonge Rushesha, Harlee Dean, Tyler Bindon and Abraham Kanu. Lewis Wing, Charlie Savage and Harvey Knibbs remain in the midfield, with a front three of Kelvin Abrefa, Sam Smith and Jayden Wareham. Aside from Joel Pereira, the bench is made up entirely of Academy graduates
